FuncDef: The display cpu-defend session-car statistics command displays whitelist session-CAR statistics on a specified interface board.
CLIs: display cpu-defend whitelist session-car { bgp | ospf | ldp-tcp | rsvp-te | pcep | web-auth-server | radius | dhcp | grpc | cusp | self-ping | ldp-udp-remote | ssh | telnet | ftp | dhcp-server | ldp-udp-local } statistics slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend whitelist-v6 session-car { bgpv6 | ospfv3 | web-auth-serverv6 | radiusv6 | dhcpv6 | grpcv6 | sshv6 | telnetv6 | ftpv6 | dhcpv6-server } statistics slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend whitelist-l2 session-car isis statistics slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a board. The value varies according to hardware.
The value is a string of 0 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display cpu-defend whitelist session-car bgp statistics slot 1
Configured CIR : 40        kbps             Actual CIR in NP : 40        kbps
Configured CBS : 100000    bytes            Actual CBS in NP : 100000    bytes
Configured PIR : 4000      kbps             Actual PIR in NP : 4000      kbps
Configured PBS : 9000000   bytes            Actual PBS in NP : 9000000   bytes
CIR Configuration Type: APP-default                 CBS Configuration Type: APP-default
PIR Configuration Type: APP-default                 PBS Configuration Type: APP-default
Configured CIR : 40        kbps             Actual CIR in NP : 40        kbps
Configured CBS : 100000    bytes            Actual CBS in NP : 100000    bytes
Configured PIR : 4000      kbps             Actual PIR in NP : 4000      kbps
Configured PBS : 9000000   bytes            Actual PBS in NP : 9000000   bytes
CIR Configuration Type: APP-default                 CBS Configuration Type: APP-default
PIR Configuration Type: APP-default                 PBS Configuration Type: APP-default

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check whitelist session-CAR statistics on a specified interface board, including session feature information and packet statistics, run the display cpu-defend session-car statistics command.
